snippet: Borghi stopped everything that England, a world power, threw at him in a 1-0 upset that was the basis of a 2005 movie.
abstract: Frank Borghi, who abandoned professional baseball career to become United States soccer team goalkeeper and went on to help US log 1-0 upset victory over England in 1950 World Cup by making save in the final minutes of the game, dies at age 89.

byline.contributor: The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Borghi stopped everything that England, a world power, threw at him in a 1-0 upset that was the basis of a 2005 movie.

headline.main: Frank Borghi, U.S. Goalkeeper in a 1950 World Cup Stunner, Dies at 89
headline.print_headline: Frank Borghi, 89, Who Saved a World Cup Upset by the U.S.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United States Men's National Soccer Team
